a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Global land spared as a result of cereal yield improvements
Land sparing is calculated as the amount of additional land that would have been needed to meet global cereal
production if average crop yields had not increased since 1961.
Data source: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (2025)
